original_solution_mapping.L1: The total number of the candies is 30 + 25 + 35 = <<30+25+35=90>>90.
original_solution_mapping.L2: When the candies are shared equally each one will get 90 / 3 = <<90/3=30>>30.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 3196.
    Returns: the number of candies each person will have.
    """
    # L1
    mark_candies = 30 # Mark has 30 candies
    peter_candies = 25 # Peter has 25 candies
    john_candies = 35 # John has 35 candies
    total_candies = mark_candies + peter_candies + john_candies

    # L2
    number_of_people = 3 # They decided to combine their candies together and share them equally.
    candies_per_person = total_candies / number_of_people

    # FA
    answer = candies_per_person
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: The total number of the candies is {mark_candies} + {peter_candies} + {john_candies} = <<{mark_candies}+{peter_candies}+{john_candies}={total_candies}>>{total_candies}.
When the candies are shared equally each one will get {total_candies} / {number_of_people} = <<{total_candies}/{number_of_people}={candies_per_person}>>{candies_per_person}.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: The total number of the candies is 30 + 25 + 35 = <<30+25+35=90>>90.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: When the candies are shared equally each one will get 30 / 3 = <<30/3=10>>10.

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'mark_candies' (value: 30) was used instead of 'total_candies' (value: 90).
